intro: If you are a guitar player you no doubt have a large collection of picks, but you probably have five or six favourites. This is a simple organizer to keep those favourites at hand and allows easy access. Since it resembles a guitar headstock, it makes a nice display as well.
intro_items: If you are a guitar player you no doubt have a large collection of picks, but you probably have five or six favourites. This is a simple organizer to keep those favourites at hand and allows easy access. Since it resembles a guitar headstock, it makes a nice display as well.
materiaux:
Supplies
  • A bamboo cutting board, sandpaper,
  • 2- 1,1/2” wood or drywall screws. Felt stick on furniture protectors.
  • A scroll saw is a necessity, also a fine toothed hand saw, a small square, 1/8” and 1/16” drill bits, a screwdriver to match your screws and a portable drill. Also you can download my templates or design your own.

etapes.html:
1. Step 1: LAYOUT

Étapes :

  1. Trace the templates on to the wood. Mark the positions of the tuning pegs and use a square to draw a line 3/8” deep at each location.

2. Step 2: CUT AND DRILL

Étapes :

  1. Fasten the board in a vise and use the hand saw to hand cut the 3/8” slots. Drill the two 1/8” holes in the base. Carefully cut out the pieces with a scroll saw. Line up the headstock with the base and drill two 1/16” pilot holes in the bottom through the holes in the base. Sand everything till smooth.

3. Step 3: ASSEMBLE

Étapes :

  1. Attach the base to the headstock with the screws. Stick on the felt protectors. Put your favourite picks in the slots and enjoy.
